dcterms:creator: D. Beßler
R. Porzel
M. Pomarlan
A. Vyas
S. Höffner
M. Beetz
R. Malaka
J. Bateman
dcterms:description: The SOMA ontology defines the semantic categories that constitute everyday activities and the relationships between entities participating in such activities, aimed at modeling knowledge about activities from both robotics and human perspectives.
dcterms:title: SOMA ontology

dcterms:creator: F. Ahrens
dcterms:description: fMRI data collected from participants who viewed complex video stimuli of activities, aimed at analyzing neuronal dynamics related to everyday activities and their implications for robot control.
dcterms:title: fMRI data from Ahrens2021

dcterms:creator: M. Meier
C. Mason
F. Putze
T. Schultz
dcterms:description: EASELAN is a modified version of the ELAN software used for annotating videos of everyday activities, specifically designed for cognitive robotics research.
dcterms:title: EASELAN

dcterms:creator: The Language Archive Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics
dcterms:description: ELAN software is used for annotating and analyzing video and audio data, facilitating the study of linguistic and non-linguistic behavior.
dcterms:title: ELAN software
